intro: Ficus ulugurensis, commonly known as the Uluguru fig, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania, where it thrives in humid, tropical conditions. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and produces small, clustered fruits that are edible. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing food for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
